cells.data:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head></head>
    <body>
        <script>

console.log("Hello, Vue! ðŸŽ‰")

// this is a single-line comment

/*
  this is a multiline comment
*/

// this is a multiple single-line comments
// this is a multiple single-line comments
// this is a multiple single-line comments

"use strict"

var bin = true
var str = "hello, world!"
var num = 3.14

console.log(bin)
console.log(str)
console.log(num)

var arr = [
	"hello, world!",
	"hello, darkness..."
]

console.log(arr)
console.log(arr[0])
console.log(arr[1])

var obj1 = {
	key1: "val1", // or "key1"
	key2: "val2"
}

console.log(obj1)
console.log(obj1.key1)
console.log(obj1.key2)
console.log(obj1["key1"])
console.log(obj1["key2"])

var obj2 = {
	obj3: {
		key1: "val1",
		key2: "val2"
	},
}

console.log(obj2)
console.log(obj2.obj3)
console.log(obj2.obj3.key1)
console.log(obj2.obj3.key2)
console.log(obj2.obj3["key1"])
console.log(obj2.obj3["key2"])

if (false) {
	console.log("if")
} else if (false) {
	console.log("else if")
} else {
	console.log("else")
}

true ? console.log(true) : console.log(false)

for (var x = 0; x < 3; x++) {
	console.log(x)
}

for (var msg of ["how", "are", "you"]) {
	console.log(msg)
}

function fun(arg) {
	if (!arg) {
		arg = "world"
	}
	return "hello, " + arg + "!"
}

console.log(fun)
console.log(fun())
console.log(fun("js"))

        </script>
    </body>
</html>
